## ‚úÖ Weekly Progress Report Complete

I've generated a comprehensive **weekly progress report** for DevTrack covering the period of **February 2-9, 2026**. The report has been saved as brain note **BN-032** with medium priority.

**üöÄ Major Accomplishments**
1. **Entity Model v2** ‚Äî 14 entity types, complete migration

runs.summary:
Perfect! I've completely rewritten the "System: Codebase Scanner & Visualizer" document with comprehensive, detailed content. Here's what I included:

## Document Structure (23,747 characters, ~150 lines)

### 1. **Overview** (3 paragraphs)
- What the system does at a high level
- How scanner and visualizer work together
- Purpose: layman-friendly architecture visualization

### 2. **Architecture Philosophy**
- **Zero-Annotation Design** ‚Äî why no special comments needed
- **Plain-English Descriptions** ‚Äî examples of generated descriptions
- Reference to ISS-007 fix

### 3. **Codebase Scanner** (largest section)
- What it scans (file types, skip patterns)
- Data extraction table (metadata, exports, imports, external calls, DB ops)
- File classification rules with examples
- Module inference strategy
- Description generation templates with code examples
- Edge label generation
- Current scan stats

### 4. **API Endpoints**
- All 9 endpoints with request/response examples
- Query paramete

  "ideas": [
    {
      "id": "IDEA-032",
      "title": "AI project initialization wizard ‚Äî full codebase audit on first run",
      "status": "validated",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "critical",
      "description": "When dev-track init runs on a new project, the AI should audit the entire codebase end-to-end: parse all source files, find docs/READMEs, read package.json/configs, scan git commit history for changelog, look for existing sprint plans/product plans/TODOs/FIXMEs. It synthesizes everything into dev-track: populates state.json with system ratings, creates backlog items from TODOs and weak areas, creates issues from known bugs and security concerns, captures ideas, rates architectural health, identifies what's half-baked vs production-ready. Should work on mid-stream projects like Pillar and Landmark ‚Äî not just greenfield.",

        "Zero-to-productive in one command",
        "Works on existing projects mid-stream",

runs.summary:
{
  "content": "{
  "name": "dev-track",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "description": "AI-native project intelligence system for rapid development",
  "type": "module",
  "bin": {
    "dev-track": "./cli/index.ts"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "concurrently \"npm run dev:server\" \"npm run dev:ui\"",
    "dev:server": "tsx watch server/index.ts",
    "dev:ui": "vite ui --port 24681",
    "build": "npm run build:ui && npm run build:server",
    "build:ui": "vite build ui --outDir ../dist/ui",
    "build:server": "tsc -p tsconfig.server.json",
    "serve": "tsx server/index.ts",
    "start": "node dist/server/index.js"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@anthropic-ai/sdk": "^0.74.0",
    "@google/generative-ai": "^0.24.1",
    "@hono/node-server": "^1.8.0",
    "@types/dagre": "^0.7.53",
    "chokidar": "^3.6.0",
    "dagre": "^0.8.5",\
